member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.MergeTree(Grasshopper.DataTree{`0})
member.summary: Merges two trees together. Data inside similar branches will be merged into single lists and unique paths will be appended. The other tree will not be altered, so beware that data is now shared among both trees.

member.remarks: Expert user function, don't go near GH_Structures if you're not intimately familiar with the Grasshopper SDK.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_ExpressionEditor.Variables
member.summary: Gets the dictionary that maintains copy of the available variables. It is important that you add variables of the correct type, so that the validity of the expression can be tested in realtime.
member.example:
How to use the Variables property when making a new GH_ExpressionEditor:
Dim editor As New GH_ExpressionEditor() editor.Expression = "Sin(p) + Cos(p*0.95) + A.z" editor.Variables.Add("p", New Expressions.VAR_Double(0.0)) editor.Variables.Add("A", New Expressions.VAR_Point(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)) editor.ShowDialog()

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.HasProxySources
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this parameter maintains proxy sources. Proxy sources are used during file IO, when actual sources might not be available yet. Once an IO operation has been completed there should be no more proxy sources.
member.returns: True if the parameter has at least one proxy source, false if not.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.ProxySourceCount
member.summary: Gets the number of proxy sources for this parameter. Proxy sources are used during file IO, when actual sources might not be available yet. Once an IO operation has been completed there should be no more proxy sources.
member.returns: The number of proxy sources associated with this parameter.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.RelinkProxySources(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document)
member.summary: Attempt to replace all proxy sources with real sources. Proxy sources are used during file IO, when actual sources might not be available yet. Once an IO operation has been completed there should be no more proxy sources.
member.param: The document from which to harvest the real source parameters.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.CreateProxySources
member.summary: Convert all proper source parameters into proxy sources.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.ClearProxySources
member.summary: Remove all proxy sources without attempting to relink them.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.AddVolatileData(Grasshopper.Kernel.Data.GH_Path,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts an item of volatile data into the data structure.
member.param: The branch path of the data. If the path doesn't exist yet, it will be created.
The item index of the data. If the path doesn't contain the index yet, it will be enlarged to encompass the index.
member.returns: True on success, False on failure. If the data cannot be converted, the topology will remain unmolested.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.InstantiateT
member.summary: Attempts to instantiate a new instance of T.
member.remarks: If T is an abstract class or if T has no default (empty) constructor, this function will ASSERT. In order to avoid a Try...Catch block performance impact, override this function and call the type constructor for T directly.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.PreferredCast(System.Object)
member.summary: Implement this function if you're certain that you'll be confronted with very common casts. For example, GH_Point has a preferred cast from Rhino.Geometry.Point3d and GH_Number has a preferred cast from System.Double.
member.param: Data to convert. Data is never null.
member.returns: An instance of T or null if you did not handle the cast.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.Cast_Object(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempts to convert the Object reference into an instance of T. This method will perform a direct cast if possible or it will call Casting functions on T or Data if they exist. Data will not be duplicated unless a type conversion is required.
member.returns: The cast value or Nothing on failure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.PostProcessData
member.summary: Apply data post-processes (simplify, reverse, graft, flatten etc. as well as overriddes processes).

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.RegisterRemoteIDsUtil(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_IdTable)
member.summary: Utility function which treats all data in the Volatile cache as IGH_GeometricGoo and registers all referenced objects. Call this function from within RegisterRemoteIDs() if you are absolutely sure that all the items in volatiledata implement IGH_GeometricGoo.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.CollectVolatileData_FromSources
member.summary: This method collects volatile data from all the source parameters.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.CollectVolatileData_Custom
member.summary: If a parameter has no sources, the CollectVolatileData_Custom() method is called. The basic implementation does nothing, but you can override this method to provide special data instantiation logic.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.OnVolatileDataCollected
member.summary: Once volatile data has been collected this method will be calles. The basic implementation does nothing, but you can add code here to post-process or analyze the volatile data.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.Format(`0)
member.summary: Returns "Null" if the data is a null reference, otherwise calls ToString() on the Data instance.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.TypeName
member.summary: Calls TypeName() on the first instance of T it can find. This is either an item in the volatile list, or a newly constructed instance.
member.remarks: Override this for improved performance, but this function is only likely to be called from the GUI.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.AppendAdditionalMenuItems(System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown)
member.summary: Override this function if you want to add specific items to the object context menu Default items already included in the menu toolstrip are: 1. Name 2. Preview 3. Warnings 4. Errors

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.ExpireOwner
member.summary: Utility method for expiring the owner component (if it exists).

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.Preview_ComputeClippingBox
member.summary: This function can be used to iterate over all items in the Volatile data tree and collect the union clipping box of all non-null items that implement Preview.IGH_PreviewData. This function requires a lot of TypeOf and DirectCasting, so if you're worried about performance you should consider doing this yourself.
member.returns: The clipping box for all valid items.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.Preview_DrawWires(Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_PreviewArgs)
member.summary: This function can be used to iterate over all items in the Volatile data tree and call DrawViewportWires on each item that implements Preview.IGH_PreviewData. This function requires a lot of TypeOf and DirectCasting, so if you're worried about performance you should consider doing this yourself.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.Preview_DrawMeshes(Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_PreviewArgs)
member.summary: This function can be used to iterate over all items in the Volatile data tree and call DrawViewportWires on each item that implements Preview.IGH_PreviewData. This function requires a lot of TypeOf and DirectCasting, so if you're worried about performance you should consider doing this yourself.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumberSliderPopup

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlTable.Row(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets a single HTML row object. Usually you do not need to set rows yourself. Consider using the Content() property instead.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlTable.Content(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the content for a specific cell. The content may contain html tags.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlTable.ColumnWidth(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the column width. The width is specified as a percentage.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlTable.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width (in page width percentages) of the entire table.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlFormatter.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of this html page The title is displayed along the top of the document.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlFormatter.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of this html page The description is displayed directly beneath the title

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlFormatter.Remarks
member.summary: Gets the list of remarks. Remarks are displayed as a bullet list underneath the contact details

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlFormatter.WebPageURI
member.summary: Gets or sets the Webpage URI (email address) for this html page The Webpage details are displayed beneath the Description section If Null or String.Empty, no webpage details are displayed

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlFormatter.ContactURI
member.summary: Gets or sets the Contact URI (name@domain.com) for this html page. The Contact details are displayed beneath the Webpage URI. If Null or String.Empty, no contact details are displayed.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlFormatter.AddRemark(System.String,Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlFormatterPalette,Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlFormatterPalette)
member.summary: Adds a remark to the list. Remarks are displayed underneath the contact details
member.param: The background colour of the remark string
The foreground colour of the remark string

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlFormatter.ReplaceSpecialCharCodes(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces special chars (© ® ™ ² ³ ×) from a string with HTML codes for those chars.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlFormatter.ReplaceBoxDrawingCodes(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces Box Drawing chars from a string with HTML codes for those chars. Tildes are replaced with Non-Breaking spaces.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.HTML.GH_HtmlFormatter.HtmlFormat
member.summary: Converts all the items in this formatter into a single HTML formatted string

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumericTextBox.Suffix
member.summary: Gets or sets the suffix used during formatting.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumericTextBox.Prefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the prefix used during formatting.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumericTextBox.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the current value. The value will be limited to the domain. You should set the domain first, or use the Set() function to set all values at once.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumericTextBox.LowerLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower limit of the scroll. Adjusting the lower limit will adjust the Value, but not the upper limit.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumericTextBox.UpperLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper limit of the scroll. Adjusting the upper limit will adjust the Value, but not the lower limit.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumericTextBox.Set(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets limits and value.
member.param: Lower limit, if l_limit is larger than u_limit, l_limit will become the upper limit.
Upper limit, if u_limit is smaller than l_limit, u_limit will become the lower limit.
Value, the value will be limited to both limits

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumericTextBox.Decimals
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of decimals displayed in the scroller.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumericTextBox.ScrollWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the scroller button.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumericTextBox.ScrollIncrement
member.summary: Gets or sets the scroll increment. The increment is used when clicking on the scroll button. Also, when the button is in scroll mode, the increment controls the change per vertical pixel.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumericTextBox.ScrollDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the damping factor of the scroller. By default, each vertical pixel alters the value by increment. Damping allows you to slow the effect of a single pixel.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_NumericTextBox
member.summary: Utility control that improves upon the standard windows numeric text box.

member.summary: Window used to edit the point-on-curve parameters in Point object references.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_TypeLib
member.summary: Utility module that caches a number of oft-used types and type-ids for quick access. Do not change any of the values in this module or you'll wreck casting and conversion logic.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for GH_Document. Makes sure all important members are initialized.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.DuplicateDocument(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document)
member.summary: Attempt to duplicate a document.
member.returns: A document similar to the input on success, or nothing on failure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Dispose
member.summary: When you discard documents you must call Dispose or the Viewport Display event handlers will not be disconnected.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ToString
member.summary: A document serializes itself using the filename of the current path. This is useful for sorting purposes and ListBoxes.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.EventServer
member.summary: Gets the event server that belongs to this document. The Event server may be in an inactive state, but it is never null.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ClearReferenceTable
member.summary: Destroys the Referenced object table in the Rhino event watcher. You must call this function if you either add or remove a reference to a Rhino object.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.StateServer
member.summary: Gets the list of stored states in this document

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ConstantServer
member.summary: Gets the dictionary of constants defined in this document.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.DefineConstant(System.String,Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_Variant)
member.summary: Add a new constant to the document. Constants are not case-sensitive, when you define a constant with an existing name, the old one will be replaced. Note: constants are as of yet unused. Eventually they are supposed to become accessible to all expressions running inside a document.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.CreateExpressionSolver
member.summary: Create a new Expression Solver preloaded with the constants defined in this document.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Thumbnail
member.summary: Gets or sets the thumbnail bitmap for this document.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.UndoServer
member.summary: Gets the UndoServer instance that belongs to this document.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.UndoUtil
member.summary: Gets a temporary undo utility instance that allows you to easily create standard undo events.
member.returns: A new instance of GH_UndoUtil set up to work with this document. Do not hang on to this object, ask for a new one every time you need it.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Undo
member.summary: Perform the first undo event.
member.returns: True on success, false on no undo event or invalid undo event.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Redo
member.summary: Perform the first redo event.
member.returns: True on success, false on no redo event or invalid redo event.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.AutoSave(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_AutoSaveTrigger)
member.summary: Creates a new autosave file on the disk. The previous autosave file (assuming it exists) will be temporarily renamed and eventually deleted entirely. Note: AutoSave is only possible on Documents that have TopLevel Rank.
member.param: Reason for autosave. User can choose to ignore certain autosave reasons.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.AutoSave(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_AutoSaveTrigger,System.Guid)
member.summary: Creates a new autosave file on the disk. The previous autosave file (assuming it exists) will be temporarily renamed and eventually deleted entirely. Note: AutoSave is only possible on Documents that have TopLevel Rank.
member.param: Reason for autosave. User can choose to ignore certain autosave reasons.
Guid of autosave operation, consecutive calls to autosave with the same Guid will be ignored.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.DestroyAutoSaveFiles
member.summary: Destroys all autosave files and backup files that are associated with this document. Only call this function when you are certain that the document has been properly saved and no changes have occured since.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Profiler
member.summary: Gets or sets the profiler mode used in this document.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Rank
member.summary: Gets or sets the Document Rank.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the enabled state for this document. Enabled documents respond to events and display their previews in the Rhino viewport.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.DocumentID
member.summary: Gets the document ID. The id is assigned at construction and never changed.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.PreviewMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the preview display mode and makes sure the conduit instance of this class is set to match.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.PreviewFilter
member.summary: Gets or set the preview filter.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Properties
member.summary: The properties of this document

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.RemotePanelProxy
member.summary: Gets or sets the Remote Control Panel proxy description for this document.

member.summary: Create a complete RCP_Proxy instance for the entire document.
member.param: If True, custom objects will be included.
If True, floating parameters will be included.

member.name: E:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.DefaultPreviewColourChanged
member.summary: This even is raised whenever the global default for Normal preview colour is changed.
member.param: the new colour assigned as default to new Documents.

member.summary: This even is raised whenever the global default for Selected preview colour is changed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the default preview colour for normal objects.

member.summary: Gets or sets the default preview colour for normal objects.

member.summary: Gets or sets the colour of unselected preview geometry.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.PreviewColourSelected
member.summary: Gets or sets the colour of selected preview geometry.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ShowPreviewSettings
member.summary: Display the Preview settings dialog.

member.summary: Wipe all caches for Viewport Preview logic.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.CreatePreviewCaches
member.summary: Recompute all caches for Viewport Preview logic.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.CreateBiasXForm(Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Compute a Display Model transform that will "pull" geometry towards the camera.
member.param: Bias indicated linear motion towards the camera.
Factor indicates linear scaling towards the camera.
member.returns: A Display Transform matrix which can be assigned to a DisplayPipeline ModelTransform.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.m_objects
member.summary: m_objects is never null. m_objCache and m_attCache can be recmoputed from the m_objects instance.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ChangeContext(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_DocumentContext)
member.summary: Place a call to the DocumentContextChanged() method on all top-level objects.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.CreateConnectivityDiagram
member.summary: Gets the connectivity diagram for the current state of this document.
member.returns: The connectivity diagram of the current state. Once objects/wires are added or removed the diagram will not update and you must request a new one.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ObjectCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of top-level objects in the document.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Objects
member.summary: Returns a list of all normal, top-level objects.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.AttributeCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of attributes in the document. Both Normal and Hidden ones

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Attributes
member.summary: Returns a list of all normal attributes
member.remarks: If the attribute cache is empty, it will be rebuild. Hence, this could be quite an expensive call to make.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.DestroyAttributeCache
member.summary: Destroys the Attribute cache. Call this function whenever you do something which might affect attributes.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.GetAllInstanceIDs(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a sorted list of all the IGH_DocumentObject instance IDs in this document.
member.param: If true, only top level objects are considered.
member.returns: A sorted fictionary of IDs and Integers. The integers represent the indices of the top-level objects that contained the ids. Since the object list inside a GH_Document is not static, these indices will not remain valid.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.MutateAllGUIDs
member.summary: Change all the instance UUIDs of all objects in the document. Be sure to resolve all proxy sources before mutating IDs. This function will ensure all groups are updated appropriately.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.DestroyObjectTable
member.summary: Erase the Object fast lookup table. You must call this whenever you add or remove objects to or from the document while circumventing the regular channels.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.RebuildObjectTable
member.summary: Destroy and rebuild the Object fast lookup table.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Internal_AddObject(Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_DocumentObject,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform basic operations required to add an object to this document. No events are raised, no updates are triggered.
member.param: Index of object, will be clipped to the valid range automatically.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Internal_RemoveObject(System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform basic operations required to remove the object at the given index from this document. No events are raised, no update is triggered.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.AddObject(Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_DocumentObject,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add a new object to the document. If the object is already contained, nothing will happen
member.param: Index at which object will be inserted.
If True, a new solution will be triggered afterwards, regardless of event response settings.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.RemoveObject(Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remove the top-level object in the attribute tree from the document. This method does not add an Undo event, that is the responsibility of the caller.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.RemoveObject(Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_DocumentObject,System.Boolean)

member.summary: Get a precooked StringFormat instance. Do not modify or dispose instances returned by this method. The format uses NoWrap flags and EllipsisCharacter trimming.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_TextRenderingConstants
member.summary: Contains app wide text-rendering constants. When you are drawing your own texts use these constants instead of TextRenderingHint::****

member.summary: Gets the outline box for this Capsule.

member.summary: Gets the content box for this Capsule. Text and icons are drawn inside this box.

member.summary: Gets the highlight size for this Capsule. Zero or negative means there is no highlight.

member.summary: Gets the radius of the rounded corners of this Capsule.
member.param:
Corner index.
0 = upper left
1 = upper right
2 = lower right
3 = lower left

member.summary: Gets the largest radius defined for this capsule.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Font to use for text rendering.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text to render in the content box.

member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the text within the content box.

member.summary: Test a point for capsule containment.
member.returns: True if the point is on the interior of the capsule.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.RenderEngine
member.summary: Gets the RenderEngine associated with this capsule. You typically don't need to go this far, just use one of the Render() overloads on GH_Capsule directly.
member.remarks: Do not store pointers to the RenderEngine, always call this property anew.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Render the capsule onto a graphics context.
member.param: Graphics object to draw with. Zoom factor is implied by the G.Transform property.
If true, the capsule will be drawn with selected colours.
If True, the capcule will be drawn in Locked style.
If True, the capsule will be drawn in Hidden style.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Have this capsule draw itself onto a Graphics surface with a custom colour override.
member.param: Graphics object to draw with. Zoom factor is implied by the G.Transform property.

Base colour for the capsule. Other colours will be derived from the base colour. If you want full control over every colour involved, then use the overload that allows you to supply a custom Style instead.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_PaletteStyle)
member.summary: Have this capsule draw itself onto a Graphics surface with a custom Style override.
member.param: Graphics object to draw with. Zoom factor is implied by the G.Transform property.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Image,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Render the capsule onto a graphics context.
member.param: Graphics object to draw with. Zoom factor is implied by the G.Transform property.
Icon to render in center of content/bounding box.
If true, the capsule will be drawn with selected colours.
If True, the capcule will be drawn in Locked style.
If True, the capsule will be drawn in Hidden style.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Have this capsule draw itself onto a Graphics surface with a custom colour override.
member.param: Graphics object to draw with. Zoom factor is implied by the G.Transform property.
Icon to render in center of content/bounding box.

Base colour for the capsule. Other colours will be derived from the base colour. If you want full control over every colour involved, then use the overload that allows you to supply a custom Style instead.

member.summary: Have this capsule draw itself onto a Graphics surface with a custom Style override.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule
member.summary: Class used to draw standard Grasshopper interface boxes.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.InnerContourPen(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a gradient from white to transparent white for the edge pen.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderGrips(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single)
member.summary: Render all the grips associates with the capsule. Grips are not drawn if the zoom level is less than 50%. This is usually the first stage in a Capsule rendering.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderGrips_Alternative(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single)
member.summary: Render all the grips associates with the capsule as semi-circles. This is needed if the capsule background is not fully opaque. Grips are not drawn if the zoom level is less than 50%. This is usually the first stage in a Capsule rendering.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderAlphaFill(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Render a standard transparancy background hatch. This is only needed when the capsule background colour is not fully opaque. This is usually the second stage in a capsule rendering, right after the Grips are drawn.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderBackground(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single,Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_PaletteStyle)
member.summary: Render a default capsule background fill. This is usually the third stage in a capsule rendering.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderBackground_Alternative(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Color,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Render a custom capsule background fill. This is usually the third stage in a capsule rendering.
member.param: If true, and the background colour is not opaque, an alpha grid will be drawn as well.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderHighlight(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single)
member.summary: Render a highlight bar. This is highly zoom-dependant. Highlight rendering is usually the fourth stage in a Capsule Rendering, after the background but prior to the edges.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderOutlines(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single,Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_PaletteStyle)
member.summary: Render default capsule outlines. If the zoom factor is less than 50% the inner outline is not drawn. This is usually the fifth stage in a Capsule rendering.
member.param: Palette style that defines edge properties.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderText(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Render the capsule text. This is usually the sixth and final stage in a capsule rendering.
member.param: Zoom factor. If the zoom-factor is so small that the Font becomes illegible, no text is drawn.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderIcon(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.InterpolationMode,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Render an image icon centered into the box. If the content box has been defined the icon will be centered there, otherwise the outline box will be used.
member.param: Pixel interpolation mode (if the graphics zoom is 100%, the interpolation mode is always NearestNeighbor.
Zoom threshold, if the zoom factor of the Graphics surface is less than the cutoff, the icon is not drawn.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderIcon(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.InterpolationMode,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Render an image icon centered into the box. If the content box has been defined the icon will be centered there, otherwise the outline box will be used.
member.param: Pixel interpolation mode (if the graphics zoom is 100%, the interpolation mode is always NearestNeighbor.
Zoom threshold, if the zoom factor of the Graphics surface is less than the cutoff, the icon is not drawn.

members.member: Static (Shared in VB) method for creating rectangles with rounded corners. dd Rectangle to fillet. Rectangles smaller than 3 pixels wide/high will be grown. Radius of corner fillets. Graphics path that describes the rounded rectangle.

Static (Shared in VB) method for creating rectangles with rounded corners. dd Rectangle to fillet. Rectangles smaller than 3 pixels wide/high will be grown. Radius of upper left corner. Zero or negative values omit fillets. Radius of upper right corner. Zero or negative values omit fillets. Radius of lower right corner. Zero or negative values omit fillets. Radius of lower left corner. Zero or negative values omit fillets. Graphics path that describes the rounded rectangle.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_WindowsControlUtil.FixTextRenderingDefault(System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection)
member.summary: Recursively sets the UseCompatibleTextRendering value to False on each control.
member.example:
This example shows how to use this function to modify all the controls on a windows Form.
Dim frm As New MyVerySpecialForm() Grasshopper.GUI.GH_WindowsControlUtil.FixTextRenderingDefault(frm.Controls)
frm.Show()

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_InstanceDescription.Write(GH_IO.Serialization.GH_IWriter)
member.summary: Default serialization. Only stores Name, NickName, Description and InstanceGuid fields. If you want to store additional fields use WriteFull() instead.
member.returns: Always True.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_InstanceDescription.Read(GH_IO.Serialization.GH_IReader)
member.summary: Default deserialization. Only retrieves Name, NickName, Description and InstanceGuid fields. If you want to retrieve additional fields use ReadFull() instead. However, ReadFull() will only work if the archive was written using WriteFull().
member.returns: Always True.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_InstanceDescription.WriteFull(GH_IO.Serialization.GH_IWriter)
member.summary: GH_InstanceDescription does not by default serialize all fields. Use this function to write all fields to the archive. This method is compatible with the default Write()/Read() operations.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_InstanceDescription.ReadFull(GH_IO.Serialization.GH_IReader)
member.summary: GH_InstanceDescription does not by default serialize all fields. Use this function to read all fields from the archive. This method is compatible with the default Write()/Read() operations.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.summary: Gets the parameter.

member.summary: Arguments used in Variable Parameter events.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VarParamComponent.IsInputVariable
member.summary: Gets a flag specifying whether or not the input can potentially contain variable parameters.
member.returns: Return TRUE to enable variable parameter UI on the input side.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VarParamComponent.IsOutputVariable
member.summary: Gets a flag specifying whether or not the output can potentially contain variable parameters.
member.returns: Return TRUE to enable variable parameter UI on the output side.

member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether a specific parameter is considered to be variable.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VarParamComponent.ConstructVariable(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_VarParamEventArgs)
member.summary: This function is called whenever a new parameter is required. You must provide a non-null instance for new_param, otherwise the addition will be cancelled. The Param field of the event arguments will typically be null.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VarParamComponent.ManagerConstructed(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_VarParamSide,Grasshopper.GUI.GH_VariableParameterManager)
member.summary: This function is called whenever a new manager is constructed. You can override this function if you wish to modify the default behaviour of the manager.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VarParamComponent.ParametersModified(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_VarParamSide)
member.summary: This function will be called wheneven the param collection of a component has been altered through the ParamManager. If your parameters have a peculiar naming scheme, this is the best place to assign those.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VarParamComponent
member.summary: This interface is obsolete, please use the IGH_VariableParameterComponent interface instead.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ParameterSide.Input
member.summary: Indicates parameters along the left edge of the component.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ParameterSide.Output
member.summary: Indicates parameters along the right edge of the component.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ParameterSide
member.summary: Enumerates possible sides for variable parameters.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent.CanInsertParameter(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ParameterSide,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function will get called before an attempt is made to insert a parameter. Since this method is potentially called on Canvas redraws, it must be fast.
member.param: Insertion index of parameter. Index=0 means the parameter will be in the topmost spot.
member.returns: Return True if your component supports a variable parameter at the given location.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent.CanRemoveParameter(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ParameterSide,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function will get called before an attempt is made to remove a parameter. Since this method is potentially called on Canvas redraws, it must be fast.
member.returns: Return True if your component supports removing a parameter at the given location.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent.CreateParameter(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ParameterSide,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function will be called when a new parameter is about to be inserted. You must provide a valid parameter or insertion will be skipped. You do not, repeat not, need to insert the parameter yourself.
member.param: Insertion index of parameter. Index=0 means the parameter will be in the topmost spot.
member.returns: A valid IGH_Param instance to be inserted.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent.DestroyParameter(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ParameterSide,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function will be called when a parameter is about to be removed. You do not need to do anything, but this would be a good time to remove any event handlers that might be attached to the parameter in question.
member.returns: Return True if the parameter in question can indeed be removed. Note, this is only in emergencies, typically the CanRemoveParameter function should return false if the parameter in question is not removable.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent.VariableParameterMaintenance
member.summary: This method will be called when a closely related set of variable parameter operations completes. This would be a good time to ensure all Nicknames and parameter properties are correct. This method will also be called upon IO operations such as Open, Paste, Undo and Redo.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent
member.summary: Implement this interface in your component if you want to enable variable parameter UI.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_IconTable.To32BppPArgb(System.Drawing.Image)
member.summary: Converts an image into 32BitPerPixelPremultipliedAlphaRedGreenBlue format. This format draws much faster in GDI+ operations. However, there will be no gain unless you cache the result of this function.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_IconTable
member.summary: Utility class for caching 32BppPArgb icons with fast lookup. Icons are hashed using an MD5 algorithm to prevent identical entries.

member.summary: You cannot construct this class, it only exposes static (Shared in Visual Basic) methods.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Layout.GH_GenericLayout.Vertical_ByIndex(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Drawing.Rectangle},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform top-to-bottom layout on a list of rectangles starting at the upper edge of the layout area. Rectangles are ordered by index. The height of the rectangles is guaranteed to remain the same.
member.param: Layout area. The bottom edge is ignored.
If True, the rectangles will be expanded to fill the entire width of the layout area.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Layout.GH_GenericLayout.Horizontal_ByIndex(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Drawing.Rectangle},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform left-to-right layout on a list of rectangles starting at the left edge of the layout area. Rectangles are ordered by index. The width of the rectangles is guaranteed to remain the same.
member.param: Layout area. The right edge is ignored.
If True, the rectangles will be expanded to fill the entire height of the layout area.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Layout.GH_GenericLayout.Vertical_ByPosition(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Drawing.Rectangle},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform top-to-bottom layout on a list of rectangles at the upper edge of the layout area.
member.param: Layout area. The bottom edge is ignored.
If True, the rectangles will be expanded to fill the entire width of the layout area.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Layout.GH_GenericLayout.Vertical_ByPosition(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Drawing.Rectangle},System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform top-to-bottom layout on a list of rectangles at the upper edge of the layout area.
member.param: Layout area. The bottom edge is ignored.
Radical index. The radical represents the special rectangle which takes positioning preference. For example, during Drag operations, the rectangle being dragged is the radical.
If True, the rectangles will be expanded to fill the entire width of the layout area.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Layout.GH_GenericLayout.Horizontal_ByPosition(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Drawing.Rectangle},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform left-to-right layout on a list of rectangles at the left edge of the layout area.
member.param: Layout area. The right edge is ignored.
If True, the rectangles will be expanded to fill the entire height of the layout area.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Layout.GH_GenericLayout.Horizontal_ByPosition(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Drawing.Rectangle},System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform left-to-right layout on a list of rectangles at the left edge of the layout area.
member.param: Layout area. The right edge is ignored.
Radical index. The radical represents the special rectangle which takes positioning preference. For example, during Drag operations, the rectangle being dragged is the radical.
If True, the rectangles will be expanded to fill the entire height of the layout area.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.GUI.Layout.GH_GenericLayout
member.summary: Generic layout logic for rectangle stacks.

member.summary: Generic n-gon slicer. If the nodes in V do not represent a valid, convex NGon then the result will not be reliable.

member.returns: Result. List may share Node instances with V

member.summary: Represents a two-dimensional voronoi diagram cell.

member.summary: This class cannot be constructed.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.Voronoi.Solver.Solve_BruteForce(Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.Node2List,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.Node2})
member.summary: Solve the voronoi diagram using a Sorted Brute force approach. Works best with a collection of nodes which are spread along the x-direction. This function will renumber and sort the nodes.
member.param: Nodes to solve for. This list will be renumbered and sorted.
member.returns: The voronoi cells. Order of cells is identical to the order of nodes.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.Voronoi.Solver.Solve_Connectivity(Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.Node2List,Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.Delaunay.Connectivity,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.Node2})
member.summary: Solve the voronoi diagram using a minimal connectivity map.
member.param: Connectivity diagram. Can be obtained from a Delaunay mesh.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.CacheSymbols(System.String)
member.summary: Create a Symbols array from the expression. Use this method if you intend to evaluate the same expression multiple times. At this point, the expression has to be in correct syntax format. Use the GH_ExpressionSyntaxWriter.RewriteAll() method to make sure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.CachedSymbols
member.summary: Retrieve a copy of the Queue of cached symbols. You can use the cached symbols as an uber-optimization to speed up successive calls to Evaluate() with an identical expression string

member.summary: Evaluate the expression currently loaded in the Symbols cache using the currently loaded variables.

member.summary: Evaluate the expression queue without overriding any local caches. You can obtain an expression queue by calling CachedSymbols()

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.Evaluate(System.String)
member.summary: Store a new expression in the Symbols cache and evaluate it using the current variables

member.summary: Test a string for balanced open and close chars. You can use this function to see if brackets or parenthesis have been properly used.
member.param: Char that indicates an opening statement.
Char that indicates a closing statement.
The index at which the first error appears or -1 if no error was found.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.IsEditorLoaded
member.summary: Returns the loaded state of the Grasshopper Main window.
member.returns: True if the Main Grasshopper Window has been loaded.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call Rhino.Print("Grasshopper Editor Loaded: " & GH.IsEditorLoaded()) Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.IsEditorVisible
member.summary: Returns the visible state of the Grasshopper Main window.
member.returns: True if the Main Grasshopper Window has been loaded and is visible.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call Rhino.Print("Grasshopper Editor Visible: " & GH.IsEditorVisible()) Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.LoadEditor
member.summary: Load the main Grasshopper Editor. If the editor has already been loaded nothing will happen.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.LoadEditor() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.ShowEditor
member.summary: Show the main Grasshopper Editor. The editor will be loaded first if needed. If the Editor is already on screen, nothing will happen.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.ShowEditor() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.HideEditor
member.summary: Hide the main Grasshopper Editor. If the editor hasn't been loaded or if the Editor is already hidden, nothing will happen.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.HideEditor() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.EnableBanner
member.summary: Enables the display of the Grasshopper banner during Component loading. The banner is typically only shown once during a Grasshopper session, namely when the Editor is first loaded.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.EnableBanner() Call GH.ShowEditor() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.DisableBanner
member.summary: Disables the display of the Grasshopper banner during Component loading. The banner is typically only shown once during a Grasshopper session, namely when the Editor is first loaded.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.DisableBanner() Call GH.ShowEditor() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.IsSolverEnabled
member.summary: Returns the state of the Grasshopper Solver.
member.returns: True if the Grasshopper Solver is enabled.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call Rhino.Print("Grasshopper Solver Enabled: " & GH.IsSolverEnabled()) Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.EnableSolver
member.summary: Enables the Grasshopper Solver. If the Solver is enabled, expired components and parameter will be recomputed.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.EnableSolver() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.DisableSolver
member.summary: Disables the Grasshopper Solver. If the Solver is disabled, expired components and parameter will not be recomputed, though any existing solution will remain intact.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.DisableSolver() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.RunSolver(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Runs the solver once, even if the global solver lock is on.
member.param: If true, will expire all objects in the current document.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.OpenDocument(System.String)
member.summary: Open a Grasshopper document. The editor will be loaded if necessary, but it will not be automatically shown.
member.param: Path of file to open (must be a *.gh or *ghx extension).
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.OpenDocument("C:\ExampleFile.ghx") Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.CloseDocument
member.summary: Close the currently active Grasshopper document. If there is not active document, nothing will happen.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.CloseDocument() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.CloseAllDocuments
member.summary: Close all Grasshopper documents.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.CloseAllDocuments() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.SaveDocument
member.summary: Save the currently active Grasshopper document. If the active document has never been saved, a Save... dialog will be shown. If there is no active document, nothing will happen.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.SaveDocument() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.SaveDocumentAs(System.String)
member.summary: Save the currently active Grasshopper document in a specific location. If there is no active document, nothing will happen.
member.param: Path of file to save to (must be a *.gh or *ghx extension).
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.SaveDocumentAs("C:\GrasshopperBackup\[" & Hour(Now()) & "][" & Minute(Now()) & "][" & Second(Now()) & "].ghx") Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Viewport.LimitUnit(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Utility function for calculating pixel dimensions in a zoom-aware environment. The desired value is put through the zoom projection and if the resulting size (as displayed on the screen) exceeds the visual limits it is clipped. This function can be used for example to make sure that a certain penwidth never exceeds visual limits (i.e. it doesn't get too thin or too thick on the screen).
member.param: Minimum allowed visible size on screen.
Maximum allowed visible size on screen.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Viewport.SolveUnit(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Utility function for calculating graphics dimensions in a zoom-aware environment. This function can be used for example to compute the linewidth of a pen which always needs to appear as 3 pixels thick on the screen regardless of zoom values.
member.param: Minimum allowed size in graphics coordinates.
Maximum allowed size in graphics coordinates.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ScheduleDelay
member.summary: Gets the delay for the next scheduled solution. If there is no solution scheduled the delay will be negative.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ScheduleSolution(System.Int32)
member.summary: Schedule a new solution after a specified time interval. The schedule is erased if another solution is triggered before the schedule is executed. Tight schedules override loose schedules. If this method is called during a solution, the schedule will be started after the current solution completes.
member.param: The delay (in milliseconds) between the completion of this solution and the start of the scheduled solution. If the delay is 1ms or more, a timer will be used to trigger a new solution sometime in the future. If a delay of 0ms is used, then the next solution will run recursively within the current solution. You should not use a delay of zero milliseconds too often as it will cause the Rhino process to run out of stack-space. The SolutionDepth property can be used to see how deeply recursive the solution currently is.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ScheduleSolution(System.Int32,Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.GH_ScheduleDelegate)
member.summary: Schedule a new solution after a specified time interval. The schedule is erased if another solution is triggered before the schedule is executed. Tight schedules override loose schedules. If this method is called during a solution, the schedule will be started after the current solution completes.
member.param: The delay (in milliseconds) between the completion of this solution and the start of the scheduled solution. If the delay is 1ms or more, a timer will be used to trigger a new solution sometime in the future. If a delay of 0ms is used, then the next solution will run recursively within the current solution. You should not use a delay of zero milliseconds too often as it will cause the Rhino process to run out of stack-space. The SolutionDepth property can be used to see how deeply recursive the solution currently is.
If not null, the callback will be called before the scheduled solution is triggered.

member.summary: Builds a subtree from a Node list.

The number of allowed Nodes per Leaf. If a Leaf contains more than N nodes, it will subdivide.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ComponentParamServer.EmitSyncObject
member.summary: Create a synch object that stores a shallow representation of this server. Cache this object if you're planning to make sweeping changes to this param-server. Then, once you are finished call the Sync() function to perform cleanup of removed parameters. This is a utility function and you can choose to perform cleanup yourself.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ComponentParamServer.Sync(System.Object)
member.summary: Sync changes from a prerecorded state. All param references in the sync object which are no longer present in the current server will be properly deleted. The sync object will be reset in the process, so you can only call this function with a specific Sync object once.
member.param: Sync object. Should be obtained by calling EmitSyncObject()

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Blank
member.summary: There is no data available in this object. This object will be solved next time a solution begins.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Collecting
member.summary: This object is currently in the process of collecting data

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Collected
member.summary: This object has finished collecting all data and is ready for computation.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Computing
member.summary: This object is currently in the process of computing new data

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Computed
member.summary: This object has successfully completed data computation and it will be skipped in the next solution unless it expires in the meantime. This is the final step in a successful solution cycle.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Failed
member.summary: This object has failed to successfully complete the data computation stage. A new attempt at solving it will be made when the next solution starts. This is the final step in an unsuccessful solution cycle.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase
member.summary: The Phase flags are used to track object states during solutions.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel.Blank
member.summary: No warnings or errors were recorded during solver-time processes

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel.Warning
member.summary: One or more warnings (but no errors) were recorded during solver-time processes

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel.Error
member.summary: One or more errors (and possibly any number of warnings) were recorded during solver-time processes.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel.Remark
member.summary: One of more messages (but no warnings and no errors) were recorded during solver-time processes.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel.All
member.summary: Indicates all possible levels.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel
member.summary: Indicates the severity of a runtime message.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_ActiveObject.ClearData
member.summary: This function is called whenever the object needs to clear all solution data. This usually amounts to wiping volatile caches and messages. This function will not affect any other objects, but it will set the Phase flag to Blank

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_ActiveObject.CollectData
member.summary: This function is called whenever the object is required to collect all data. Either from Persistent records, from source params or whatever. This step is only performed if the phase flag is Blank or Failed. Upon completion, the phase flag will be set to Collected

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_ActiveObject.ComputeData
member.summary: This function is called whenever the object is required to generate new data. This step is only performed by some objects and only when the Phase flag is Collected. Upon completion, the Phase will be Computed. If this object throws exceptions, it is the responsibility of the caller to set the Phase flag to Failed.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_ActiveObject.Phase
member.summary: Gets the solution phase in which this object is currently stuck.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_ActiveObject.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets the locked flag of this object. Locked objects are ignored during solutions.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ActiveObject.ExpireSolution(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Informs the document that owns this object that the solution has expired. The current object will be set to BLANK as a result. This method is recursive, it will also expire any and all objects which depend on this object. If you want a less destructive expiration, consider using ClearData(). If this object is already Blank, you should consider not expiring it.
member.param: If True, the document will be instructed to solve the new state.

member.summary: This function is called whenever the solution for this object expires. Override this function if objects depend on you.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ActiveObject.RuntimeMessageLevel
member.summary:
Returns the worst case flag for the current object
If the object contains at least 1 error, the result is Error.
If the object contains at least 1 warning, the result is Warning.
If the object contains at least 1 message, the result is Remark.
If the object contains no errors, no warnings and no messages, the result is Blank.

member.summary:
Override this function if you want to add additional items to the object context menu. Default items already included in the menu toolstrip are:
1. Name
2. Preview
3. Warnings
4. Errors
5. [additional items will be inserted here]
6. Help

member.summary: Convert data from the unknown type to a target type. Conversion is optimized and will only duplicate data if the types are not the same.
member.param: Output, is expected to be null.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementStreamPath
member.summary: Increment the stream path. If there are no input parameters, the path root is incremented. If there is only a single input param, that path is copied. If there is only a single connected input param, that path is copied. If there are multiple connected input params, the most complex path is copied.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.FindMasterParameter(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Attempts to find the most important input parameter that controls the path of the output data.
member.param: Index of master parameter (if found, otherwise -1)
member.returns: True if a master parameter is found, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.SingleConnectedParameter
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the parameter which is the only connected one. If no parameters are connected or if two or more parameters are connected, null is returned.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.MostComplexParameter
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the most complex parameter. This is either the parameter with the longest paths, or it is the parameter with the the most branches.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementBranchIndices
member.summary: Call this function to increment the branch indices. At present all branch indices are incremented whenever possible. This amounts to "Longest List Matching" logic. This function also resets all item indices.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure. If none of the branch indices are incremented, you should stop iteration.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementItemIndices
member.summary: Call this function to increment the item indices inside the branches. Incrementation will occur in accordance with the DataMatching property of the owner component.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure. If the indices cannot be incremented, you should increment the branches next.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementItemIndices_ShortestList
member.summary: Increments all item indices using ShortestList Matching algorithms. If all parameters have been successfully incremented, the result is True.
member.returns: True if all non-list parameters have been incremented successfully.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementItemIndices_LongestList
member.summary: Increments all item indices using LongestList Matching algorithms. If at least one parameter has been successfully incremented, the result is True.
member.returns: True if at least one non-list parameters has been incremented successfully.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementItemIndices_All(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Attempts to increment all item indices. Indices are not incremented beyond the end of their list. And list parameters are not incremented at all.
member.param: The number of successfully incremented indices.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementItemIndices_CrossReference(System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to increment one item index.
member.param: This function is recursive. If you're calling it from elsewhere, then supply zero as the layer hint.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.UpdateBranchReference(System.Int32)
member.summary: This will update the cached reference and length of branch at the given parameter index (layer). The m_branch_index(layer) value must be correct before calling this function.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.UpdateBranchLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the branch length cache for a given branch index (layer). Before you call this function make sure that the m_branch_ref field is already up to date.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.GH_GeometricGoo`1.Transform(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Transforms the object or a deformable representation of the object.
member.returns: Transformed geometry. If the local geometry can be transformed accurately, then the returned instance equals this instance. Not all geometry types can be accurately transformed under all circumstances though, if this is the case, this function will return an instance of another IGH_GeometricGoo derived type which can be transformed.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.GH_GeometricGoo`1.Morph(Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph)
member.summary: Morph the object or a deformable representation of the object.
member.returns: Deformed geometry. If the local geometry can be deformed accurately, then the returned instance equals this instance. member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_GraphicsUtil.BlendInteger(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates a linear blend between two extremes. Although the inputs are unlimited integers, the output is an integer in the byte range (0-255).
member.returns: Interpolated value.
member.example:
This function is useful when you need to link colour alpha amounts to zoom levels:
Sub DrawZoomAwareCircle(ByVal G As Graphics, _ ByVal center As PointF, _ ByVal radius As Single, _ ByVal fill As Color) 'Find the zoom level of the Graphics transform. Dim zoom As Single = G.Transform.Elements(0)
'Abort if zoom less than 25% If (zoom < 0.25f) Then Return
'Blend the alpha channel byte between 25% and 95% zoom. Dim alpha As Int32 = GH_GraphicsUtil.BlendByte(0.25, 0.95, 0, 255, zoom) G.FillEllipse(center.X - radius, center.Y - radius, _ 2.0f * radius, 2.0f * radius, _ New SolidBrush(Color.FromARGB(alpha, fill))) End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_GraphicsUtil.FadeColour(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Fade a colour to transparency by linearly blending a parameter between extremes.
member.param: Blending factor between t0 and t1.
member.returns: The colour adjusted for blending.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_GraphicsUtil.BlendColour(System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Overlays two colours. The Alpha component of the top colour controls the blend.
member.returns: The blended colour. Alpha channels are added together.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_GraphicsUtil.BlendColour(System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,System.Double)
member.summary: Overlays two colours.
member.param: Blend factor. 0.0 means the return colour will be identical to the bottom colour, 1.0 means the return colour will be identical to the top colour.
member.returns: The blended colour.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_GraphicsUtil.RenderTag(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.StringAlignment,System.Drawing.StringAlignment)
member.summary: Render a text tag into a Graphics surface.
member.param: The frame into which the tags should be aligned.
member.example:
This example shows how to render the 8 corner and edge tags into a rectangle:
Function RenderCornerAndEdgeTags(ByVal G As Graphics, ByVal frame As RectangleF) Dim font As New Font("Courier New", 8) Dim bg As Color = Color.White Dim fg As Color = Color.Black
'Render the 4 corner tags RenderTag(G, "UL", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Near, StringAlignment.Near) RenderTag(G, "UR", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Far, StringAlignment.Near) RenderTag(G, "LR", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Far, StringAlignment.Far) RenderTag(G, "LL", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Near, StringAlignment.Far)
'Render the 4 edge tags RenderTag(G, "T", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Center, StringAlignment.Near) RenderTag(G, "R", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Far, StringAlignment.Center) RenderTag(G, "B", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Center, StringAlignment.Far) RenderTag(G, "L", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Near, StringAlignment.Center) End Function

member.param: The name of the settings server (equals the name of the xml file so it must adhere to FAT, FAT32 and NTFS naming conventions).

member.summary: Find all the settings in this table that adhere to a certain search pattern.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_FontServer.NewFont(System.String,System.Single,System.Drawing.FontStyle)
member.summary: High level function for Font creation. We've ran into loads of trouble in the past with missing Fonts. Never create a font directly via GDI+, always use this method.
member.param: Font Family Name. If a font is found with the exact name, it will be loaded.
Font style, if the requested family does not support the requested style, the style flags will be ignored.
member.returns: A font that might or might not be what you asked for.
